content:
That sounds like an amazing experience! Sundance is one of the most prestigious film festivals in the world, and being able to participate in their online program is a great way to access new and exciting films, as well as connect with the filmmakers themselves.

"The Mole Agent" and "Minari" are both highly acclaimed films, and I'm sure the Q&A sessions were fascinating. Maite Alberdi's "The Mole Agent" has been getting a lot of buzz for its unique blend of documentary and spy thriller elements, and Lee Isaac Chung's "Minari" has been praised for its poignant and intimate portrayal of the Korean-American experience.

It's great that you were able to attend the online Q&A sessions, which must have added an extra layer of depth to your experience. Hearing from the filmmakers themselves can provide valuable insights into the creative process and the themes they're exploring in their work.

Did you have a favorite film or Q&A session from the festival? Were there any particular themes or topics that resonated with you across the different films you watched?
